scenes.goal: Introduce recursion as a problem-solving technique
visual_elements: Simple diagram of a function calling itself
scenes.narrative_intent: Hook the audience by defining recursion and showing its core idea visually.

visual_elements: Flowchart with a 'Base Case' stop node
scenes.narrative_intent: Clarify that recursion needs a stopping condition to prevent infinite loops.

visual_elements: Flowchart with 'Recursive Step' arrow looping back
scenes.narrative_intent: Show how a problem is broken into smaller subproblems via a recursive call.

visual_elements: Stack diagram with frames labeled factorial(3), factorial(2), factorial(1), factorial(0)
scenes.narrative_intent: Demonstrate how the runtime manages function calls and returns.

visual_elements: Side-by-side panels: recursion flowchart vs for-loop diagram
Code snippets: recursive factorial vs iterative factorial
scenes.narrative_intent: Highlight trade-offs and when to choose recursion over iteration.

visual_elements: Checklist: define base case, ensure progress, watch stack depth
scenes.narrative_intent: Warn about stack overflow and emphasize careful design.
